Title: Meeting the team.
Long: I arrived in Ushuaia, at the southern tip of Argentina. After checking in to my hotel and exploring the town, I met the rest of the team for an introductory dinner.

Title: Crevasse rescue practise.
Long: We spent the morning checking equipment and studying maps. In the afternoon we travelled to a small glacier near Ushuaia and practised ropework and crevasse rescue techniques.

Title: We boarded the boat.
Long: In the morning we boarded Icebird, the yacht we'll be sailing to Antarctica in. The crew are hard at work loading supplies, and we spent the afternoon loading our expedition gear into the hold.

Title: We set sail at last!
Long: After a lengthy delay we manage to get the departure paperwork in order, and set sail. Just a short trip across the Beagle Channel today to the Chilean town of Puerto Williams.

Title: The last anchorage before the Drake.
Long: More delays from the Chilean immigration service, but we finally get moving again. Again just a short hop today, down to Isla Lennox - one of the last sheltered anchorages before the start of the Drake Passage.

Title: At last we set sail across the Drake Passage.
Long: At last we set sail on the three day crossing of the Drake Passage.

Title: Damage to the yacht.
Long: The yacht is damaged overnight and we have to make improvised repairs to the rigging.

Title: Glorious weather?
Long: Hydraulics system breaks down, but the backup is working fine. Glorious weather all day.

Title: Finally we reach land.
Long: Glass flat water as we finish the Drake crossing and reach the spectacular anchorage at Two Hummock Island.

Title: Got our skis on but atrocious conditions.
Long: We have our first short ski of the trip, but miserable conditions for it, so we keep it short.

Title: Windy in the Errera Channel.
Long: We reassess our main objective and we're invited ashore by the Chilean base.

Title: Starting out first major expedition.
Long: Not great conditions as we tackle crevasses and low visibility on our hike to the first camp.

Title: Stuck in camp all day.
Long: Temperatures are well above freezing, and we're waiting in camp all day. Visibility just isn't good enough for safely navigating the steeper slopes.

Title: A break in the weather and we're off!
Long: Finally the weather clears enough for us to climb a few of the smaller peaks. Amazing views between the clouds from the top!

Title: We summit the previously unclimbed Mount Guterch.
Long: A hard day slog, but we managed to get the first ascent of Mount Guterch, 1,103m.

Title: A day of sea kayaking in the Lemaire Channel.
Long: We take the sea kayaks for a paddle down the Lemaire Channel and almost get trapped in the sea ice.

Via: Climbed to overlook the Wiggins Glacier
Title: We climb to the Wiggins Glacier lookout.
Long: After several changes of plans, we eventually take a simple route up to the most amazing view.

Title: Another new objective, and this time it's a big one!
Long: We start the long trek inland to the first camp. Please forgive me for continually saying Mont François... It should be Mont Français.

Title: All day with zero visibility.
Long: We trek all day across the glacial plateau in a complete whiteout - not even the horizon visible for most of the day. Again sorry for calling it Mont François... It should be Mont Français.

Title: We reach the summit of Mont Français 2,810m!
Long: An epic day, we climb 2,100m to the summit. Perfect conditions for the ascent, and beautiful snow on the descent.

Title: We take a well earned zero day.
Long: We take a day off and stay in camp. The weather is looking good for another ascent tomorrow...

Title: Across the plateau back towards the boat.
Long: Another change of plans and the weather looks like it's turning bad, so we hike all the way back to the boat.

Title: Bad weather on the horizon.
Long: We start our return crossing of the Drake, and bad weather is lurking on the forecast for later in the week.

Title: Good weather so far...
Long: No major upsets yet on our return crossing, but tomorrow looks worse.

Title: No sign of this storm yet...
Long: Another lovely day but the seasickness drugs are really me low-energy today.

Title: Yet another beautiful day.
Long: We've been really lucky with the weather, and have another beautiful day's sailing.

Title: We round Cape Horn and arrive back in Chile.
Long: We arrive in Puerto Williams in the nick of time before the storm hits. We'll be hunkering down here for a couple of days until it blows over.
